poem:
**Newsprint Reverie**

High above the typeface sky,  
Kemi glances, asks the moon,  
Does color migrate with time,  
Or does it blend, an unseen tune?  
Keir walks the lines of power,   
In tariff shadows, seeking sun,   
While voices murmur in the dark—  
Stories start where words begun.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kemi Badenoch gives credence to race-swap conspiracy theory about Adolescence but admits she hasn’t watched it – as it happened 5.50pm BST Afternoon summary Keir Starmer has rejected claims that the expected imposition of US tariffs on Britain means he has been “played” by President Trump. Starmer said that the UK and the US were at an “advanced stage” in negotiating an economic deal, and he suggested that this could lead to the UK getting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
